author: Felicia Tan
title: Singapore‚Äôs GDP grew by 2.7% in 1Q2024 based on advance estimates; MAS to maintain current rate of appreciation
text:
Singapore‚Äôs gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 2.7% in the 1Q2024, according to the Ministry of Trade and Industry‚Äôs (MTI) advance estimates released on April 12.
The figure stood slightly ahead of market watchers‚Äô expectations of a 2.6% y-o-y growth in the Monetary Authority of Singapore‚Äôs (MAS) March 2024 survey of professional forecasters .
On a q-o-q seasonally adjusted basis, the economy expanded by 0.1%.
The manufacturing sector grew by 0.8% y-o-y in the 1Q2024, moderating from the 1.4% y-o-y expansion in the previous quarter.
The construction sector expanded by 4.3% y-o-y, extending the 5.2% y-o-y growth in the 4Q2023.
The wholesale & retail trade and transportation and storage sectors collectively expanded by 2.7% y-o-y, accelerating from the 1.0% growth in the quarter before.
Learn More
See also: Singapore set to keep monetary policy tight, may ease in October
The group of sectors comprising the information & communications, finance & insurance and professional services sectors grew by 4.2% y-o-y in the 1Q2024, outpacing the 3.6% y-o-y growth seen in the 4Q2023.
Growth of the remaining group of services sectors (i.e., accommodation & food services, real estate, administrative & support services and other services sectors) grew by 2.9% y-o-y in the 1Q2024, higher than the 2.0% growth in the preceding quarter.
At the same time, MAS announced that it will maintain the prevailing rate of appreciation of the Singapore dollar nominal effective exchange rate (S$NEER) policy band. There will be no change to its width and the level at which it is centred, says the central bank in its April 12 announcement.
See also: Singapore economy ‚Äòdrifting sideways‚Äô, says PhillipCapital
It adds that the current monetary policy settings remain ‚Äúappropriate‚Äù with the Singapore economy expected to strengthen over 2024. Growth is expected to become more broad based.
‚ÄúThe slightly negative output gap is projected to narrow further in 2H2024, even as underlying inflationary pressures gradually dissipate,‚Äù says MAS.
The country‚Äôs core inflation is expected to remain elevated in the ‚Äúearlier part of the year‚Äù but should remain on its ‚Äúbroadly moderating path‚Äù and lower in the 4Q2024 before falling even further in 2025.
‚ÄúThe prevailing rate of appreciation of the policy band is needed to keep a restraining effect on imported inflation as well as domestic cost pressures, and is sufficient to ensure medium-term price stability,‚Äù continues MAS.

title: Fiscal√≠a peruana presenta otra denuncia contra Pedro Castillo - RT
text:
Fiscal√≠a peruana presenta otra denuncia contra Pedro Castillo Publicado: 27 jun 2024 21:40 GMT El Ministerio P√∫blico de Per√∫ present√≥ este jueves una nueva denuncia constitucional contra el expresidente de ese pa√≠s, Pedro Castillo Terrones, por la presunta comisi√≥n de delito de negociaci√≥n incompatible o aprovechamiento indebido del cargo y nombramiento ilegal, en agravio del Estado.
La acusaci√≥n fue impuesta a trav√©s del √Årea de Enriquecimiento Il√≠cito y Denuncias Constitucionales, debido a que la Fiscal√≠a considera que Castillo vulner√≥ la ley al nombrar como presidente del directorio de Perupetro S.A., a Daniel Enrique Salaverry Villa, el 9 de enero de 2022, "pese a que no cumpl√≠a con los requisitos legales para el cargo".
El expresidente Castillo , quien alega ser v√≠ctima de una persecuci√≥n judicial desde que era jefe de Estado, se encuentra detenido desde 2022 bajo prisi√≥n preventiva, acusado como responsable de rebeli√≥n ‚Äîtras su intento de disolver el Congreso de la Rep√∫blica‚Äî y de ser el presunto l√≠der de una organizaci√≥n criminal mientras fue mandatario.
üì¢ Fiscal√≠a de la Naci√≥n, a trav√©s del √Årea de Enriquecimiento Il√≠cito y Denuncias Constitucionales, present√≥ denuncia constitucional contra el expresidente de la Rep√∫blica, Jos√© Pedro Castillo Terrones. pic.twitter.com/prcaPP5WIO
‚Äî Ministerio P√∫blico (@FiscaliaPeru) June 27, 2024

author: ArcaMax Publishing, Inc.
title: Extreme temperatures in Boise cause an unexpected hazard: 'dangerous' falling tree limbs | News & Features | ArcaMax Publishing
text: Extreme temperatures in Boise cause an unexpected hazard: 'dangerous' falling tree limbs Published in [News & Features](/currentnews/newsheadlines/) BOISE, Idaho ‚Äî As Boise residents seek shelter from extreme heat this summer, tree canopies may seem like the perfect relief outdoors. But those leafy branches pose another unexpected danger that comes with the hot weather. Triple-digit temperatures in the City of Trees have been causing otherwise healthy tree limbs to fall unexpectedly ‚Äî a condition known as sudden limb drop syndrome. Mike Andrews, the city‚Äôs forester, said the syndrome is more common in middle-aged to mature trees. Boise‚Äôs forestry team is working hard to remove fallen branches as quickly as possible but can‚Äôt do much to prevent it from happening, he said. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want people to just be scared of sitting under a beautiful tree, but you should be aware of your surroundings,‚Äù Andrews told The Idaho Statesman. ‚ÄúFor the last couple of weeks now, we have just filled up our days with tree limb removal.‚Äù Arborists can‚Äôt often predict which trees will be susceptible to limb loss, Andrews said, though the city ‚Äî when it‚Äôs not busy with branch removal ‚Äî prunes and removes foliage on trees to reduce the chances they fall prey to the syndrome. Branches that grow parallel to the ground are more likely to snap off, and pruning those branches can help mitigate risk, he added. Fallen or damaged branches in public spaces can be reported to the city‚Äôs Community Forestry staff, and officials prioritize removal based on hazard levels. ‚ÄúMany of the fallen branches don‚Äôt drop off within seconds, but if you don‚Äôt notice the signs, it can be dangerous,‚Äù Andrews said. The Idaho Transportation Department, however, hasn‚Äôt seen an increase in dropped branches this year, spokesperson John Tomlinson told the Statesman. Most of the trees are mature and healthy when they begin to lose limbs because of extreme temperatures, though ITD has also had to remove dead trees along Idaho 55 that posed serious hazards to drivers. Last year, a dead ponderosa pine fell on a car along the popular highway during a windy storm and killed a 13-year-old boy who was traveling with his grandmother. A month after the fatality, the agency removed 150 dead trees that stood near the road along the same area, according to previous Statesman reporting. The ITD team continues to monitor tree health and work with state and federal agencies to remove hazards, and will begin pruning and tree removal along Idaho 55 within the next few months, Tomlinson told the Statesman. While arborists still don‚Äôt know what causes sudden limb drop, they have two main theories, Andrews told the Statesman. One theory: Hot temperatures cause trees to retain water within their wood, resulting in water weight the branches can‚Äôt handle. The other theory involves tree cells, which expand and contract as they move around more water in high heat. The constant contractions buckle and crack the wood, resulting in less stable tree branches that eventually snap off. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs still a lot of debate about why trees will completely shed healthy limbs during hot temperatures,‚Äù Andrews said. Whether trees that have lost limbs will recover depends on the size of the tree, the branch that fell, and how much of the tree was lost, Andrews added. Tree disease, underwatering and insect infestations can also affect tree health, especially during prolonged periods of hot temperatures, said Zachary Zehnder, a Boise certified arborist at SavATree LLC, a lawn care company. Maintaining health is important to reducing the risk of tree deaths, Zehnder told the Statesman. Although the likelihood that tree death and falling limbs will injure people is rare, there is also a threat of damage to houses and other buildings, he added. To reduce risk, homeowners should water their trees, use insecticides and fertilizers, and keep an eye out for signs of heat stress in trees, like curling bark and burnt leaves. ‚ÄúThis will definitely be a problem that‚Äôs going to continue with overall climate change,‚Äù Zehnder said. ¬©2024 The Idaho Statesman. Visit idahostatesman.com. Distributed by Tribune Content Agency, LLC.

author: Redacci√≥n HuffPost
title: Alertan de la peligrosa estafa del obispo
text:
Alertan de la peligrosa estafa del obispo
Dos obispos han sido v√≠ctimas de suplantaci√≥n de identidad durante esta semana, tanto por tel√©fono como con un v√≠deo publicado.
Las estafas telef√≥nicas cada vez son m√°s comunes. Ya no solo son peligrosos los mensajes de texto que llegan a nuestros m√≥viles con enlaces trampa. Los estafadores se atreven incluso a llamar haci√©ndose pasar por otras personas imitando sus voces.
Sobre esto √∫ltimo ha alertado el Obispado de Bilbao, que
 en un comunicado publicado esta semana alertaba haber detectado llamadas de alguien suplantando la identidad del obispo, Joseba Segura, pidiendo dinero a una comunidad de religiosas.
En concreto, la persona que ha llamado en nombre del obispo bilba√≠no les informaba de que han recibido un donativo y que, para recibirlo, deben pagar los gastos de transferencia mediante un ingreso previo. "Desde Secretar√≠a General se ha remitido una nota a los responsables de vida consagrada y de clausura advirtiendo del hecho y subrayando que el obispo no ha llamado ni llamar√° nunca para pedir dinero a las comunidades religiosas", asegura el Obispado.
Asimismo, solicita "que, ante la sospecha de cualquier estafa, se pongan en contacto con el obispado y, en caso de que se haya realizado cualquier pago, acudan a las autoridades competentes a interponer la correspondiente denuncia‚Äù.
Dos v√≠ctimas en una semana
Un d√≠a antes de salir a la luz esta denuncia de la di√≥cesis de Bilbao, el obispo de Urgel, Joan-Enric Vives, ya hab√≠a sido v√≠ctima de un delito de suplantaci√≥n de identidad, aunque en este caso se trata de la circulaci√≥n de un v√≠deo falso en el que alguien se hace pasar por √©l. Los hechos fueron denunciados a los Mossos d'Esquadra, alegando el derecho a "tomar las acciones legales oportunas contra sus autores", tal y como public√≥ el Obispado en su cuenta de la red social X.

author: @latestly
title: Latest News | Playing Roles of Sahibzadas in Events on 'Veer Bal Diwas' Against Sikh Traditions: SGPC
text:
Amritsar (Punjab), Dec 29 (PTI) The Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) on Friday said schoolchildren playing the roles of Sahibzadas Zorawar Singh and Fateh Singh in plays during 'Veer Bal Diwas' events was against Sikh principles and traditions.
The Centre announced last year that December 26 would be observed as 'Veer Bal Diwas' to mark the martyrdom of Guru Gobind Singh's younger sons and various events were organised on the occasion this year.
Also Read |
India‚Äôs Remarkable Strides in 2023: A Year of Achievements Across Multiple Fronts.
In a statement, the SGPC said it has sought an explanation from the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) along with the Ministries of Education, Culture and Minority Affairs of Government of India in the matter.
According to the statement, SGPC president Harjinder Singh Dhami said that "any such anti-Sikh act cannot be accepted".
Also Read |
Year Ender 2023: From Turkey-Syria Earthquake to Israel-Hamas War and Russia‚Äôs Failed Moon Mission, Here Are Top Nine Global Events of The Year.
Dhami said that any act against Sikh principles, customs, traditions and values hurts the Sikh sentiments and pointed out that objections are coming from the Sikh community about the acts of playing roles of the 'Sahibzadas' in physical form "under the instructions of the central government regarding 'Veer Bal Diwas' in educational institutions in various states".
(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
